intro: Disterigma pilosum, commonly known as the hairy disterigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are typically trifoliate. It produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Disterigma pilosum is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
